section.title: Declarative Package Management

note.para: Some packages require additional global configuration such as D-Bus or systemd service registration so adding them to might not be sufficient. You are advised to check the list of options whether a NixOS module for the package does not exist.

section.para:
You can get a list of the available packages as follows:
$ nix-env -qaP '*' --description nixos.firefox firefox-23.0 Mozilla Firefox - the browser, reloaded ...
The first column in the output is the attribute name, such as nixos.thunderbird.

Note: the nixos prefix tells us that we want to get the package from the nixos channel and works only in CLI tools.
In declarative configuration use pkgs prefix (variable).
To “uninstall” a package, simply remove it from and run nixos-rebuild switch.
